alert.note: Alert for Milwaukee (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued September 12 at 5:54AM CDT until September 14 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Milwaukee
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Milwaukee/Sullivan WI has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Wisconsin... Root River At Franklin affecting Milwaukee County.Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. && ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THIS MORNING TO WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Root River At Franklin. * WHEN...From early this morning to Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, A low spot on Oakwood Road in southern Milwaukee County is flooded. Other flooding effects are confined mainly to agricultural land. Forecast At 9.5 feet, Portions of Root River Parkway flooded. Water approaches 8 Mile Rd and 27th St. Root River Parkway near Cleveland Ave in West Allis and near Layton Ave in Greenfield may be flooded. Nicholson Rd flooded. A portion of Oakwood Road in southern Milwaukee County is flooded and closed. There is widespread flooding to agricultural land. A stage of 9.51 feet is the 10 percent chance flood meaning that there is a 10 percent chance in any given year of the river reaching this level. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:00 AM CDT Monday the stage was 8.1 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 5:00 AM CDT Monday was 8.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 9.5 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 9.5 feet on 05/18/2020. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && River forecasts are available for some but not all river gaging locations. The 7 day river forecast takes into account past precipitation, soil moisture conditions, and predicted precipitation for the basin. Precipitation is for the next 24 hours in the future from April through September and for 48 hours in the future from October through March. (Stages in ft.) Bank- Latest Forecast stages - Flood full observed ...for 7 am...
